content:
I'm excited to explore the idea of adding more details to my models. For my Japanese Zero fighter plane, I think I'll start by adding a pilot figure and maybe some ground equipment like fuel drums or ammo crates. I'll also consider adding some texture and weathering effects to the airfield diorama to give it a more realistic, battle-worn look.

For my Ferrari 288 GTO model, I like the idea of adding a figure of a racing mechanic and a miniature toolbox. I might also add some details like a racing helmet, a pit board, or even a miniature trackside scene with grandstands and other racing cars. I'll definitely keep in mind the importance of balance and subtlety when adding details, and focus on creating a compelling story with my diorama.

Speaking of details, I've been thinking about adding some additional features to my models, like opening doors or movable parts. Do you have any tips or recommendations for adding these kinds of details to my models?
